sentence: This process resulted in 46 articles from 42 studies that met the eligibility criteria (Figure 1).
All the 95% CIs were overlapped, indicating there were not significant differences in the relationships between physical abuse and Level-1 or Level-2 behavior problems (see Figure 2 and Table 3).

Specifically, the associations of emotional abuse with Level-2 behavior problems, including depression, self-injury behavior, and somatic complaints, were higher than that of emotional abuse with aggression (p values < .05; see Figure 3 and Table 3).
Neglect was also associated with all Level-2 behavior problems about equally because all 95% CI overlapped (see Figure 4 and Table 3).

Favors B indicates that child maltreatment increases behavior problems, while Favors A indicates child maltreatment decreases behavior problems.Mixed Child Maltreatment
All studies that examined the relationship between child maltreatment without differentiating its subtypes reported increased externalizing (Hedges’s g = .713, 95% CI [0.436, 1.989]) and internalizing (Hedges’s g = .626, 95% CI [0.260,0.902]) behaviors about equally (Figure 5 and Table 3).
The funnel plots were symmetrical (Figure 6).
This process resulted in 46 articles from 42 studies that met the eligibility criteria (Figure 1).
All the 95% CIs were overlapped, indicating there were not significant differences in the relationships between physical abuse and Level-1 or Level-2 behavior problems (see Figure 2 and Table 3).
